examples.sentence: I was planning to go, but something came up at work.
examples.translation: 가려고 했는데, 회사에서 갑자기 일이 생겼어요.

examples.sentence: Something came up, so I had to cancel my plans.
examples.translation: 갑자기 일이 생겨서 계획을 취소해야 했어요.

examples.sentence: I ran into a problem while setting up my new phone.
We ran into a problem with the reservation.
My car broke down on the way to work.
The elevator broke down, so I had to take the stairs.
Everything went wrong that day.
I don't know what went wrong with my plan.
Our travel plans fell through at the last minute.
The deal fell through because of budget issues.
I messed up the reservation date.
I accidentally messed up the order.
I totally screwed up my presentation.
They screwed up my order at the restaurant.
I got stuck in traffic for two hours.
The elevator got stuck between floors.
I ran out of battery in the middle of nowhere.
examples.translation: 아무 데도 아닌 곳에서 배터리가 다 됐어요.

examples.sentence: We ran out of time before finishing the project.
examples.translation: 프로젝트를 끝내기 전에 시간이 다 됐어요.

examples.sentence: I missed out on the early bird discount.
I missed out on the concert because of work.
I lost track of time and missed my appointment.
examples.translation: 시간 가는 줄 모르고 약속을 놓쳤어요.

examples.sentence: I lost track of where I parked my car.
I got lost on my way to the meeting.
We got lost in the new city without GPS.
examples.translation: GPS 없이 새 도시에서 길을 잃었어요.

examples.sentence: It completely slipped my mind to call you back.
examples.translation: 전화 다시 하는 걸 완전히 깜빡했어요.

examples.sentence: The meeting slipped my mind because I was so busy.
The sudden question caught me off guard.
The change in schedule caught everyone off guard.
The news took me by surprise.
The sudden rain took us by surprise.
Out of the blue, my boss called me into his office.
She quit her job out of the blue.
All of a sudden, my phone stopped working.
All of a sudden, the lights went out.
The store closed without warning.
Without warning, the app crashed.
They canceled the event at the last minute.
I had to change my flight at the last minute.
I missed the bus. To make matters worse, it started raining.
examples.translation: 버스를 놓쳤어요. 설상가상으로 비까지 오기 시작했어요.

examples.sentence: My phone died. To make matters worse, I didn't know the address.
examples.translation: 폰 배터리가 나갔어요. 설상가상으로 주소를 몰랐어요.

examples.sentence: I was late. On top of that, I forgot my wallet.
The food was bad. On top of that, the service was terrible.
I had to figure out how to fix it myself.
We finally figured out what the problem was.
Everything worked out in the end.
Don't worry, things will work out.
I need to sort out this mess.
Let me sort out the schedule first.
I had to deal with the situation calmly.
Let me deal with this problem first.
Don't worry, I'll take care of it.
The manager took care of the issue right away.
I'll look into the issue and get back to you.
They're looking into what caused the error.
I managed to get through the difficult situation.
We'll get through this together.
I had to come up with a solution quickly.
We came up with a backup plan.
I turned to my friend for help.
When I'm in trouble, I turn to my family.
I reached out to customer service for help.
Don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything.
I called up the airline to change my flight.
I called up my friend to ask for directions.
I looked up the address on my phone.
I looked up how to fix it online.
I asked around to find the best restaurant.
Let me ask around and see if anyone can help.
examples.translation: 주변에 물어봐서 도와줄 사람이 있는지 볼게요.

examples.sentence: I tracked down the lost package.
I managed to track down the information I needed.
I finally got hold of the manager.
I couldn't get hold of a taxi during rush hour.
They fixed up the issue within an hour.
Can you fix me up with a rental car?
I patched up the tire and drove to the nearest station.
examples.translation: 타이어를 임시로 고치고 가까운 주유소로 갔어요.

examples.sentence: We patched up our differences and moved on.
I had to put off my trip due to the emergency.
examples.translation: 긴급 상황 때문에 여행을 미뤄야 했어요.

examples.sentence: We put off the meeting until next week.
They called off the outdoor event because of the rain.
I had to call off my dinner plans.
My friend backed out at the last minute.
You can't back out now, we already made plans.
examples.translation: 이미 계획을 세웠는데, 이제 와서 빠지면 안 돼요.

examples.sentence: I had to switch to a different flight.
We switched to plan B.
I opted for a refund instead of a replacement.
We opted for indoor activities due to the weather.
I had to settle for a different hotel.
We settled for pizza since the restaurant was closed.
I ended up taking a taxi instead of the bus.
We ended up staying home because of the rain.
examples.translation: 비 때문에 결국 집에 있게 됐어요.

examples.sentence: It turned out to be a blessing in disguise.
Everything turned out fine in the end.
I almost gave up, but I kept trying.
Don't give up, you're almost there.
Let's hold off on the decision until we have more information.
examples.translation: 정보가 더 있을 때까지 결정을 미루죠.

examples.sentence: I held off on buying the ticket hoping for a better deal.
examples.translation: 더 좋은 거래를 기대하며 티켓 구매를 보류했어요.

examples.sentence: The meeting was pushed back to 3 PM.
They pushed back the deadline by a week.
We had to move up the departure time.
Can we move up the meeting to 10 AM?
I had to reschedule my appointment.
They rescheduled the concert due to the weather.
I had to make do with what I had.
We made do with instant noodles for dinner.
I freaked out when I realized I lost my wallet.
examples.translation: 지갑을 잃어버린 걸 알았을 때 기겁했어요.

examples.sentence: Don't freak out, we can fix this.
I took a deep breath to calm down.
Calm down, everything is going to be okay.
I was really stressed out about the situation.
examples.translation: 그 상황 때문에 정말 스트레스 받았어요.

examples.sentence: Don't stress out, it's not a big deal.
examples.translation: 스트레스 받지 마세요, 별 일 아니에요.

examples.sentence: I tried to cheer up after the disappointment.
Cheer up, there will be other opportunities.
examples.translation: 기운 내세요, 다른 기회가 있을 거예요.

examples.sentence: I went for a walk to cool off.
Let's take a break and cool off.
I felt let down when the event was canceled.
I don't want to let you down.
It took me a while to get over the disappointment.
examples.translation: 실망을 극복하는 데 시간이 좀 걸렸어요.

examples.sentence: I still can't get over what happened.
examples.translation: 아직도 있었던 일을 잊을 수가 없어요.

examples.sentence: I tried to brush off the negative comments.
Just brush it off and move on.
Look on the bright side, at least we're safe.
I tried to look on the bright side of the situation.
I tried to keep my cool during the stressful situation.
examples.translation: 스트레스 받는 상황에서 침착함을 유지하려고 했어요.

examples.sentence: It was hard to keep my cool, but I managed.
I almost lost my temper, but I held back.
I'm sorry, I lost my temper earlier.
I went to the gym to blow off steam.
After the stressful day, I needed to blow off some steam.
examples.translation: 스트레스 받는 하루 후에 스트레스를 풀어야 했어요.

examples.sentence: I was so relieved when I found my keys.
I was relieved that everything worked out.
I was frustrated because nothing was working.
I felt frustrated with the slow service.
I was embarrassed when I realized my mistake.
I was so embarrassed that I wanted to disappear.
I was panicked when I couldn't find my passport.
Don't be panicked, let's think calmly.
I couldn't believe what had just happened.
examples.translation: 방금 무슨 일이 있었는지 믿을 수가 없었어요.

examples.sentence: I couldn't believe my luck.
I was shocked to find out the store was closed.
examples.translation: 가게가 문을 닫은 걸 알고 충격받았어요.

examples.sentence: I was shocked by the unexpected news.
I usually check my phone first thing in the morning.
examples.translation: 보통 아침에 일어나면 제일 먼저 폰을 확인해요.

examples.sentence: I usually take public transportation to work.
Normally, I would have double-checked, but I was in a hurry.
examples.translation: 평소에는 두 번 확인했을 텐데, 서둘러서요.

examples.sentence: Normally, this wouldn't be a problem.
examples.translation: 평소에는 이게 문제가 안 됐을 거예요.

examples.sentence: I typically wake up around 7 AM.
Typically, the process doesn't take this long.
examples.translation: 보통 절차가 이렇게 오래 안 걸려요.

examples.sentence: Every time I go there, something goes wrong.
Every time I try to book, it's fully booked.
Whenever I'm stressed, I go for a walk.
Whenever this happens, I call customer service.
examples.translation: 이런 일이 생길 때마다 고객센터에 전화해요.

examples.sentence: I check my email on a regular basis.
This kind of thing happens on a regular basis.
From time to time, I run into unexpected problems.
This happens from time to time.
Once in a while, I treat myself to something nice.
Once in a while, things don't go as planned.
examples.translation: 가끔 계획대로 안 될 때가 있어요.

examples.sentence: Now and then, I like to try new things.
examples.translation: 때때로 새로운 것을 시도하는 걸 좋아해요.

examples.sentence: I make mistakes now and then.
Every now and then, I like to escape the city.
Every now and then, technology fails us.
I kept trying until I succeeded.
I keep forgetting to bring my umbrella.
I tend to forget things when I'm stressed.
I tend to procrastinate on important tasks.
I'm used to dealing with unexpected situations.
examples.translation: 예상치 못한 상황에 대처하는 데 익숙해요.

examples.sentence: I'm not used to this kind of problem.
I eventually got used to the new system.
It takes time to get used to changes.
I'm in the habit of checking things twice.
I'm not in the habit of staying up late.
Luckily, I found a solution just in time.
Luckily, someone helped me.
Fortunately, no one was hurt.
Fortunately, I had a backup plan.
Unfortunately, there was nothing I could do.
examples.translation: 안타깝게도, 제가 할 수 있는 게 없었어요.

examples.sentence: Unfortunately, the event was already sold out.
Thankfully, my friend was there to help.
Thankfully, I managed to catch the last train.
In the end, everything worked out fine.
In the end, it was a valuable learning experience.
It turns out I had the wrong address.
It turns out the problem was simpler than I thought.
I learned a lesson from that experience.
I learned my lesson and always double-check now.
examples.translation: 교훈을 얻어서 이제 항상 두 번 확인해요.

examples.sentence: I promised myself never again to make the same mistake.
examples.translation: 같은 실수를 다시는 안 하겠다고 다짐했어요.

examples.sentence: Never again will I forget to check my reservation.
examples.translation: 다시는 예약 확인을 잊지 않을 거예요.

examples.sentence: From now on, I'll always bring a backup.
From now on, I'll be more careful.
Next time, I'll plan ahead more carefully.
examples.translation: 다음에는 더 신중하게 미리 계획할 거예요.

examples.sentence: Next time, I'll know better.
Looking back, I should have been more prepared.
Looking back, it was actually a funny experience.
All in all, it was a valuable experience.
All in all, I'm glad I handled it well.
At least I learned something from it.
At least it wasn't as bad as it could have been.
On the bright side, I got to explore a new area.
examples.translation: 긍정적으로 보면, 새로운 지역을 탐험할 수 있었어요.

examples.sentence: On the bright side, at least I wasn't hurt.
Despite the trouble, it was worth it.
In the end, all the stress was worth it.
It wasn't ideal, but it could have been worse.
examples.translation: 이상적이진 않았지만, 더 나빠질 수도 있었어요.

examples.sentence: I'm just glad it could have been worse but wasn't.
examples.translation: 더 나빠질 수 있었는데 그러지 않아서 다행이에요.

examples.sentence: I decided to file a complaint about the service.
You can file a complaint with customer service.
I asked for a refund because the product was defective.
I had to ask for a refund after the cancellation.
I requested a replacement for the broken item.
They offered to request a replacement right away.
I asked to speak to a manager about the issue.
examples.translation: 그 문제에 대해 매니저와 얘기하고 싶다고 했어요.

examples.sentence: Can I speak to a manager, please?
I explained the situation to the staff.
Let me explain the situation from the beginning.
They apologized for the inconvenience.
I apologized for being late.
They offered a discount to make it up to me.
I'll make it up to you next time.
The company offered compensation for the delay.
They offered compensation in the form of a voucher.
I was wondering if you could help me with this.
examples.translation: 혹시 이것 좀 도와주실 수 있을지 해서요.

examples.sentence: I was wondering if there's another option.
Would it be possible to change my reservation?
Would it be possible to get a refund?
Is there any way to fix this issue?
examples.translation: 혹시 이 문제를 해결할 방법이 있을까요?

examples.sentence: Is there any way you could help me out?
Could you please check again?
Could you please explain the process?
What should I do in this situation?
What should I do if this happens again?
examples.translation: 이런 일이 또 생기면 어떻게 해야 하나요?

examples.sentence: Can you help me with this problem?
examples.translation: 이 문제 좀 도와줄 수 있나요?

examples.sentence: Can you help me with the directions?
examples.translation: 길 안내 좀 도와줄 수 있나요?

examples.sentence: Thank you so much, I really appreciate it.
I appreciate your help with this matter.
There was a mix-up with my order.
There was a mix-up with the reservation dates.
There seems to be a problem with my order.
There seems to be some misunderstanding.
It looks like there's been an error.
It looks like the system is down.
I noticed that my order was wrong.
I noticed that the date was incorrect.
I realized that I had made a mistake.
I realized that I forgot my wallet.
The thing is, I need to change my plans.
The thing is, I wasn't expecting this at all.
examples.translation: 사실은 이건 전혀 예상 못 했어요.

examples.sentence: What happened was, my alarm didn't go off.
examples.translation: 무슨 일이 있었냐면, 알람이 안 울렸어요.

examples.sentence: What happened was, I got stuck in traffic.
examples.translation: 무슨 일이 있었냐면, 교통 체증에 갇혔어요.

examples.sentence: The problem is, I don't have my receipt.
The problem is, no one was available to help.
examples.translation: 문제는 도와줄 사람이 아무도 없었다는 거예요.

examples.sentence: I had no choice but to wait.
examples.translation: 기다리는 것 외에 선택의 여지가 없었어요.

examples.sentence: I had no choice but to change my plans.
examples.translation: 계획을 바꾸는 것 외에 선택의 여지가 없었어요.

words.word: There was nothing I could do
words.pronunciation: ðer wɒz ˈnʌθɪŋ aɪ kʊd duː

meanings.meaning: 내가 할 수 있는 게 없었다

examples.sentence: There was nothing I could do about the delay.
examples.translation: 지연에 대해 제가 할 수 있는 게 없었어요.

examples.sentence: There was nothing I could do but wait.
examples.translation: 기다리는 것 외에는 할 수 있는 게 없었어요.

examples.sentence: I didn't expect this to happen.
examples.translation: 이런 일이 생길 거라고 예상 못 했어요.

examples.sentence: I didn't expect it to take so long.
I didn't know the store was closed on Sundays.
I didn't know I needed a reservation.
It was my first time using the system.
It was my first time visiting that place.
At that moment, I realized something was wrong.
examples.translation: 그 순간, 뭔가 잘못됐다는 걸 깨달았어요.

examples.sentence: At that moment, I didn't know what to do.
examples.translation: 그 순간, 뭘 해야 할지 몰랐어요.

examples.sentence: As soon as I noticed the problem, I called for help.
As soon as I arrived, I realized I forgot my ticket.
